author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Bonds of the Eurozone, once on steady feet,
Weakening now, a recovery discrete,
Their yields do rise, though treasures yet lie neat,
Thus, Bund's restraint in Commerzbank's defeat.

The artisans of Germany feel weight,
Four months of ebb, the losses won't abate,
Less industrious in frosty month of late,
Decreasing yield, unwanted twist of fate.

Yet, Engie sings a sweeter song of wealth,
With profits growing, bolstering their health,
Their outlook glows, their year-end forecast stealth,
Of non-nuclear gains amassed by stealth.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Market Recovery Seen Questioned
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields rose in early trading, with Commerzbank Research saying the recovery was already faltering “with Bunds weakening—also versus Treasurys.”

feedItems.title: German Industry Continues to Weaken
feedItems.description: German industrial production fell 1.4% in September, a much steeper decrease than expected, marking a fourth straight month of declining output.

feedItems.title: Engie Upgrades Outlook on Improved Third Quarter
feedItems.description: Engie said it now expected to report non-nuclear underlying earnings of €9-€10 billion for the year after it posted increased profits for the first nine months.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
UBS hath tasted bitter brew,
Credit Suisse, a costly stew.
Swung to loss, the coffin nail,
Their balance books a mournful tale.

To Nintendo now, we raise our glass,
In profit halls they've come to pass.
Super Mario's filmic charm,
Hath kept their coffers safe from harm.

Now onto Aramco's plight,
Profits fallen, a woeful sight.
Oil’s price and volumes sold,
In pain of purse, the tale's retold.

feedItems.title: UBS Reports Loss as Credit Suisse Costs Weigh
feedItems.description: UBS swung to a wider-than-expected net loss in the third quarter, as Credit Suisse integration-related expenses weighed.

feedItems.title: Nintendo Raises Earnings Forecasts After Profit Climbs
feedItems.description: Nintendo raised its fiscal-year earnings forecasts after a rise in first-half net profit, thanks to the success of a Super Mario film and stronger sales.

feedItems.title: Aramco Profits Fall on Lower Prices
feedItems.description: Saudi Arabia’s national oil company reported a drop in third-quarter profits to $33 billion due to lower energy prices and volumes sold.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of AB Foods, a tale I tell,
Whose profits did grow and swell.
Half a billion shares they seek,
In the fiscal year at its peak.

Next in our saga, Capgemini,
Their quarterly gains did the clouds outshine.
Despite forecasts of lesser might,
They persevere, in the fiercest fight.

Last in our chronicle, stands MTN,
Whose profits rise like a steadfast wren.
With revenue gain and outlook bright,
They journey on through the pitch-black night.

feedItems.title: AB Foods Launches Buyback
feedItems.description: AB Foods said it would aim to buy back £500 million in shares over the next year after its fiscal 2023 profits rose 9%.

feedItems.title: Capgemini Backs Forecasts After Revenue Rise
feedItems.description: Capgemini confirmed its financial targets for the year after it posted revenue growth in the third quarter, although slightly less than analysts had forecast.

feedItems.title: MTN Maintains Outlook as Profits Rise
feedItems.description: MTN posted higher earnings in the first nine months, helped by a 9% rise in service revenue and confirmed its expectations for the full year.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
From Nippon's heart, a sorrowed echo rings,
By tech and craft, entwined in dark despair.
Shackled by cost, swift wings of commerce clipped,
The Nikkei falls, 'neath heavy heart's weighted air.

A change in skies, a crewman's path reformed,
The once familiar trudge, now stirred in flight.
In quest for hands, the grande dame plies her charm,
Her mighty plane, a testament to might.

Hearken the voice of law, its whispers keen,
From Fifth's own courts, the stones of justice fly.
In question lie the lives, so caught between,
A right to arm, a right to life, a sigh.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 1.3%, Dragged by Electronics, Tech Stocks
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in electronics and tech stocks, as concerns resurfaced about costs of borrowing.

feedItems.title: Your Pilot Has a New Job---and a Bigger Plane to Fly
feedItems.description: The industrywide battle for pilots has jolted the slow, methodical career progress to which many were accustomed

feedItems.title: Why So Many Controversial Supreme Court Cases Come From the Fifth Circuit
feedItems.description: The Supreme Court has some really controversial cases on its docket —including whether domestic abusers should have access to guns and whether the abortion pill should be legal. They all came from one lower court: the Fifth Circuit. WSJ explains why.
